intro: Asperula albiflora, commonly known as white woodbine, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia and the Pacific Islands. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant features slender, twining stems that often climb or trail along the ground. Its small, white to pale pink flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom in late spring to early summer. Asperula albiflora is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
